results.text: By trying to read the target you instead give away more about yourself. The target creature identifies one thing that you’re trying to conceal. This may be a secret, a truth, or a personal failing (real or perceived).
You’re sure this person is lying. You believe one truthful piece of information to be a lie.

You incorrectly assess the target’s feelings towards you. You believe that the target’s attitude towards you is the opposite (i.e., a friendly creature is hostile, an apathetic creature is interested, etc.).
The creature you’re attempting to get a read on catches you staring at them uncomfortably long. The target’s attitude towards you decreases by one step.
You attempt to subtly clue in an ally on one of your suspicions, but you aren’t as slick as you thought. The target creature catches you, and if appropriate, turns hostile.
You’ve gotten your own insecurities mixed up with your target’s. Choose one thing that you are insecure about. You are absolutely sure that the target creature is insecure about the same thing.
